author: sky.cactus
content: Is there a hard fork mailing list one can subscribe to?  If not, I feel like that could be very valuable, especially if it only sent out three emails: The first when a fork block is chosen/finalized, a second 2 weeks before the fork, and third at the time of the fork.  This would make the mailing list incredibly low volume and thus high specific value.  I would sign up for such a list!

author: abcoathup
content:
We put the upgrade block in Dates of Note section in Week in Ethereum News and get shouty as it gets closer asking people to update their nodes, it is the first item in last weeks newsletter.

Maintaining a newsletter just for upgrades isn't a big deal if there was demand.

author: sky.cactus
content: I wouldn't want to subscribe to a weekly Ethereum newsletter.  Too spammy for me (I already get an inordinate number of emails every day).  I think the more targeted the mailing list the better, as it allows people to more selectively subscribe to notifications.

author: abcoathup
content:
Upgrades could be added to events in this Discord.

If you get enough reactions, then I'd be happy to create an Ethereum Upgrades newsletter, unless someone from EF wants to do it.
